content: Following up from https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/90018#discussion_r731112936: When I first started working on rustdoc I had to figure out what 'docblock' meant (after all, isn't everything we generate 'doc's?). I'm still not 100% sure what it means. It seems like an important concept in maintaining the HTML for rustdoc though. Maybe we can settle on a definition and add it to https://rustc-dev-guide.rust-lang.org/rustdoc-internals.html ?
For me it's where documentation of an item is

But isn't that the whole page? One good definition would be "a docblock contains words written by the doc author (in markdown)." But the type-decl uses the docblock class, and doesn't contain words written by the doc author.

I guess what I'm getting at is that we should remove the docblock class from type-decl, and style it directly as .type-decl with whatever styles it then winds up missing.
Yeah I find the docblock class confusing too
